author: Judith Braun
title: Hitzenächte bergen Schlaganfall-Risiko, wie Forscher entdeckt haben
text:
Hitzenächte bergen Schlaganfall-Risiko, wie Forscher entdeckt haben
Schlaganfälle drohen nicht nur im Alter. Medizinische Studien bestätigen: Hohe Nachttemperaturen steigern das Risiko.
Frankfurt – Ein Schlaganfall stellt einen medizinischen Notfall dar, bei dem die Blutversorgung des Gehirns abrupt gestoppt wird. Diese plötzliche Erkrankung kann lebensgefährlich sein und oft zu dauerhaften neurologischen Schäden führen. In Deutschland sind jährlich etwa 270.000 Menschen von einem Schlaganfall betroffen, was ihn zu einer der häufigsten Ursachen für Tod und Behinderung macht.
Die normale Blutversorgung bestimmter Bereiche des Gehirns wird bei einem Schlaganfall unterbrochen. Da das Gehirn keine eigenen Energiereserven hat, ist es auf eine ständige Zufuhr von Sauerstoff und Nährstoffen angewiesen. Bereits nach wenigen Minuten ohne ausreichende Durchblutung beginnen die Nervenzellen, auch Neuronen genannt, abzusterben. Es gibt verschiedene Risikofaktoren, die einen Schlaganfall begünstigen können.
Forscher untersuchen Zusammenhang zwischen Temperatur und Schlaganfall-Risiko
Die Gefahr, einen Schlaganfall zu erleiden, gilt nicht nur ältere Menschen. Obwohl das Risiko mit zunehmendem Alter steigt, kann laut der Deutschen Schlaganfall-Hilfe jeder, vom Baby bis zum älteren Menschen, betroffen sein. Neben unveränderlichen Risikofaktoren wie Alter, genetische Veranlagung, Geschlecht oder Umweltbedingungen spielen auch vermeidbare Faktoren eine Rolle. Dazu gehören unter anderem Übergewicht, Bluthochdruck und Bewegungsmangel. Forscher haben nun herausgefunden, dass auch nächtliche Hitze im Sommer das Risiko für einen Schlaganfall erhöhen könnte.
Die Wissenschaftler untersuchten in einer im European Heart Journal veröffentlichten Studie den Zusammenhang zwischen Temperatur und Schlaganfallhäufigkeit in der Region Augsburg über die letzten 15 Jahre. Die Analyse ergab, dass in Nächten mit extrem hohen Temperaturen mehr Schlaganfälle auftraten. Das Risiko soll um sieben Prozent gestiegen sein. Zudem berichtete das Deutsche Ärzteblatt, dass die Anzahl der heißen Nächte in den letzten Jahren zugenommen hat.
Nächtliche Hitze erhöht Schlaganfall-Gefahr: Mögliche Ursachen
Die Studienergebnisse zeigten, dass das Risiko bei nächtlicher Hitze sowohl für Mini-Schlaganfälle, sogenannte transitorisch-ischämische Attacken (TIA), als auch für ischämische Schlaganfälle (Hirninfarkte) anstieg. Für hämorrhagische Schlaganfälle (Hirnblutungen) bestand kein Zusammenhang. Besonders gefährdet seien Menschen ab 65 Jahren und Frauen, aber auch bei jüngeren Personen und Männern erhöhte sich das Risiko in besonders warmen Nächten. Die meisten durch nächtliche Hitze ausgelösten Schlaganfälle traten innerhalb der ersten 48 Stunden nach Temperaturanstieg auf.
Die Forscher vermuten zwei Hauptursachen für das erhöhte Schlaganfall-Risiko durch nächtliche Hitze. Einerseits könnte Dehydrierung (Flüssigkeitsmangel) während der Nacht eine Rolle spielen. Andererseits könnte die Hitze den Schlaf und die tageszeitliche Regulierung der Körpertemperatur stören. Laut der Deutschen Gesellschaft für Neurologie könnte dies die Regeneration des Gehirns beeinträchtigen. Die Studienergebnisse verdeutlichen die Bedeutung von Hitzeschutzmaßnahmen zur Schlaganfallprävention. (jbr)

author: AFP
title: Spanish Catholic Church suspends priest accused of selling Viagra - Insider Paper
text: A Spanish priest has been temporarily suspended by the Roman Catholic Church after he was accused of selling drugs including the erectile dysfunction medication [Viagra](https://insiderpaper.com/not-only-viagra-brazil-military-also-bought-penis-implants-says-lawmaker/). The clergyman from Don Benito, a town of around 35,000 residents in the western Extremadura region, was detained Monday on suspicion of “trafficking narcotic substances”, the diocese of Plasencia, which is responsible for his parish, said in a statement Thursday. After his arrest, the priest, whose identity has been withheld, was provisionally released by the investigating judge, the diocese said, expressing its “pain and dismay at the suffering and scandal” caused by the events. While it waits for a “clarification” of what happened, the diocese said it felt it was “appropriate, at this time, to temporarily remove him from the public exercise of the ministry and from his office as parish priest”. The clergyman has been offered “psychological and spiritual accompaniment”, the statement said. [Spanish](https://insiderpaper.com/14-missing-after-deadly-spain-apartment-block-fire/) media said the priest was involved in the trafficking of Viagra, aphrodisiacs and narcotics along with a second arrested man, whom the reports said was his lover. The two men, who had been under police surveillance for several months, used a home rented by the priest to store the products, according to the online newspaper El Espanol, which said the news caused “disbelief” among the parish’s faithful.

author: T13
title: A los 78 años murió la cantante británica Marianne Faithfull, intérprete de "As Tears Go By"
text:
A los 78 años murió la cantante británica Marianne Faithfull, intérprete de "As Tears Go By"
La cantante y actriz británica Marianne Faithfull, conocida por su canción "As Tears Go By", murió a los 78 años en Londres, anunció un portavoz el jueves en una declaración transmitida a AFP.
"Es con una profunda tristeza que anunciamos el fallecimiento de la cantante, compositora y actriz Marianne Faithfull. Ha muerto hoy tranquilamente en Londres, en compañía de su familia. La echaremos mucho de menos", indicó el portavoz.
Faithfull encarnó el rock'n'roll desde el Swinging London hasta la escena punk neoyorquina en una larga trayectoria que tuvo sus subas y bajas.
Su voz, fina y clara en "As tears go by" (1964) capaz de convertirse en un tono grave en "Broken English" (1979), era reconocible al instante, sobre todo para los nostálgicos del rock melancólico y literario.
Nacida en Londres el 29 de diciembre de 1946, de padre espía y madre austrohúngara descendiente del barón von Sacher Masoch, Faithfull había sobrevivido a sobredosis de drogas, suicidios, a la calle, al alcohol, al cáncer e incluso el coronavirus, que la obligó a pasar tres semanas hospitalizada en Londres.
Lee También
Una humorista que triunfó en Viña y chicos realities: Los nuevos confirmados a la ‘Gala del Pueblo’ de Naya Fácil
Siempre asociada a Mick Jagger, con quien compartió su vida y aventuras a finales de los años 60.
A los 68 años, incluso posó para una campaña publicitaria de Yves Saint Laurent.
A los 17 años grabó la primera canción de Keith Richards y Mick Jagger, que su productor consideró demasiado sentimental. Con "As tears go by", la joven entró en el Top 10 británico.
Lee También
Carla Jara sorprendió a Diego Urrutia con romántico saludo de cumpleaños: compartió inéditas fotos juntos
Síguenos en

author: Adam Sparks
title: Tennessee football: Nico Iamaleava as Vols starting quarterback
text: Nico Iamaleava embraces spotlight as Tennessee's starting quarterback: 'I'm ready for the challenge' [Adam Sparks](https://www.knoxnews.com/staff/2648359001/adam-sparks/) ORLANDO, Fla. – [Nico Iamaleava](/story/sports/college/university-of-tennessee/football/2023/12/27/josh-heupel-nico-iamaleava-citrus-bowl-tennessee-football-vs-iowa/71985014007/) stepped away from his teammates after practice, entered the scrum of reporters and took center stage as [Tennessee](https://www.knoxnews.com/sports/govolsxtra/)'s starting quarterback. He’s going to be there for a while. “I was excited, man (to learn I was starting),” Iamaleava said on Thursday. “I finally get to go out there and showcase my talents as a starter. It should be fun.” Iamaleava, the freshman and former five-star recruit, said he learned he would get his first start in the [Cheez-It Citrus Bowl](/story/sports/college/university-of-tennessee/football/2023/12/03/tennessee-iowa-citrus-bowl-2023-college-football-schedule/71673250007/) “right when we got into bowl prep, around Christmas time.” On Wednesday, everyone else learned, at least for certain, that [quarterback Joe Milton was opting out](/story/sports/college/university-of-tennessee/football/2023/12/27/joe-milton-opt-out-citrus-bowl-nico-iamaleava-start-tennessee-football-vs-iowa/71885159007/) and Iamaleava would start. No. 21 Tennessee (8-4) plays No. 17 Iowa (10-3) on Monday (1 p.m. ET, ABC) at Camping World Stadium. The quarterback transition appeared complete when Iamaleava, who had only done a few media appearances in the past year, was surrounded by reporters after on-site bowl practice on the UCF campus. Iamaleava wore a “No. 8 Nico” gold medallion around his neck and Ugg slippers on his feet. And he talked with the laid-back demeanor of a California kid and the confidence of a five-star quarterback. “It’s my first start and it's going against a top-5 defense, I’m ready for the challenge,” Iamaleava said. “And I’m ready to go out there and compete with my brothers. As a quarterback, as a man, I think I’ve grown huge over this past season.” Nico Iamaleava's last game like this was in high school Iamaleava appeared in four games as Milton's backup this season, but those were in mop-up duty to finish off lopsided victories. It’s been more than a year since Iamaleava has played in a football game that wasn’t already in the bag, and that was in high school. On Nov. 4, 2022, Iamaleava passed for 260 yards, rushed for 51 yards and booted a soaring punt to the 1-yard line in Warren High’s 22-21 loss to Sierra Canyon in a Division 2 California state playoff game. He won’t have to punt in the Citrus Bowl, but he’ll need to do a lot to beat Iowa. The Hawkeyes rank No. 4 in scoring defense (13.2 ppg), No. 5 in total defense (274.8 ypg), No. 8 in passing defense (172.2 ypg) and No. 13 in rushing defense (102.5 ypg). It’s not an ideal opponent for a quarterback’s first start. But Iamaleava said he prepared for his opportunity whenever it came. “I think in high school, I let a lot of my skill and talent take over,” Iamaleava said. “When I got to this level, I really started learning defenses and where bodies are going. (I am) just seeing defenses better now. That was a huge thing for me. I really wanted to know coverages and breaking down defenses.” Why Tennessee teammates believe in Iamaleava Iamaleava has been more myth than player to most Tennessee fans. His signing a year ago was celebrated like he was the second coming of Peyton Manning. And his recruit ranking was neck-in-neck with Arch Manning as the top quarterback prospects in the country. But at Tennessee, Iamaleava has played only 52 snaps. He is 16-of-26 passing for 163 yards, one TD and no interceptions. However, his coaches and teammates have seen Iamaleava’s progress in practice over the past year. His combination of talent and humility has made him a respected player among the Vols. And they’ve admittedly bought into the hype of the five-star freshman. NICO JOINS PEYTON MANNING, CASEY CLAUSEN [How Tennessee freshman QBs fared in bowl games](/story/sports/college/university-of-tennessee/football/2023/12/27/nico-iamaleava-tennessee-football-quarterback-freshman-starter-peyton-manning/71922967007/) “I believe in Nico 100 percent,” defensive lineman Bryson Eason said. “My comparison – who I feel like he plays like – is a much taller Bryce Young because of how smooth he is. Nico is going to be great for us, and we’re ready to see where it goes after this game.” Iamaleava said he was encouraged by the reaction of his teammates to the news of him starting. “I think they responded well when Coach (Josh Heupel) told them,” Iamaleava said. “I’ve tried to be good with all the guys during my time here. I think I’ve built good relationships with all the guys throughout the season.” Vols know torch has passed from Joe Milton Iamaleava’s relationship with Milton matters in the Citrus Bowl. Milton, a sixth-year senior, opted out to prepare for the NFL Draft. But he remains with the team during practices and meetings, and [he’ll be on the sideline during the Citrus Bowl](/story/sports/college/university-of-tennessee/football/2023/12/27/joe-milton-tennessee-football-citrus-bowl-opt-out-nico-iamaleava/71985409007/). “(That relationship) has been huge. Going into this season, just having Joe, I knew I was going to be able to learn a lot about how to be a college football player, learn how to be a pro,” Iamaleava said. “Joe is an open book. I can ask him anything, and he has no problem giving me the answer. He’s been there since day one. And I really appreciate him.” But Milton’s tenure as Tennessee’s starting quarterback is over and Iamaleava’s is about to begin. And all the Vols know it. "Joe has still been around helping. He’s a true leader. But I think Nico is ready,” running back Dylan Sampson said. “Everybody has full faith and confidence in him. I think it’s just time to let him go. It’ll be fun.” Adam Sparks is the Tennessee football beat reporter. Email [adam.sparks@knoxnews.com](mailto:adam.sparks@knoxnews.com). X, formerly known as Twitter [@AdamSparks](https://twitter.com/AdamSparks). Support strong local journalism by subscribing at [knoxnews.com/subscribe](https://subscribe.knoxnews.com/offers). Get the latest news and insight on SEC football by subscribing to the [SEC Unfiltered newsletter, delivered straight to your inbox.](https://profile.tennessean.com/newsletters/sec-unfiltered/)

author: Anthony Ailemen
title: Easter: Tinubu felicitates with Christians, calls for sacrifice
text:
President Bola Tinubu on Friday, joined Christian faithful to commemorate Easter, urging them to emulate the love and sacrifice of Jesus Christ, for mankind.
In his message to Nigerians commemorating Easter, President Tinubu, commended Nigerians for the sacrifices they have made in the past few months of his administration, for the nation to be steered to the path of recovery and sustainable growth.
The President described Easter as a significant moment and a glorious celebration of the triumph of life over death, charging Christians in Nigeria and around the world to emulate Jesus’ love, sacrifice, and compassion as the patent themes of this solemn season.
Read also:
Tinubu’s economic Odyssey: From promises to perplexities in Nigeria delinquent economy
President Tinubu said the sacrifice of Jesus Christ for humanity is an emphatic lesson for leaders and all Nigerians to yield to selflessness and compassion, and be steadfast in the pursuit of a united, peaceful, and prosperous nation.
He noted that the seeds of patience which they have sown are beginning to sprout and will in no time bring forth an abundance of good fruits
President Tinubu assured all citizens that Nigeria will triumph over its challenges as his administration remains firmly committed to this end.
“The President wishes Nigerians, Happy Easter.”

author: Sam Courtney-Guy
title: Racist cyclist assaulted a child and knocked hats off Jewish people’s heads
text:
A man is being hunted after roving around North
London on a bicycle attacking Jewish people.
The suspect was caught on CCTV last Thursday passing a synagogue on Cavenove Road, Stamford Hill, and striking the hat off the head of an elderly man in traditional Jewish worship clothes as he chatted to a friend.
Moments earlier he was seen committing the same attack on others.
In one clip, he appears to reach out to knock one pedestrian’s hat off but misses as the man evades him.
Police say the suspect went on to assault a child and believe there were other victims who have yet to come forward.
The Shomrim neighbourhood watch group said others have been physically struck in the head.
The unknown male fled before officers arrived and no arrests have been made so far.
Latest London news
-
I'm still shaking days after watching Stranger Things: The First Shadow
-
London's most expensive home of 2023 comes with a ballroom and serious bragging rights
-
There's a new busiest train station in London after 16 years
To get the latest news from the capital visit Metro.co.uk's
 London news hub.
Police have deployed extra patrols in an area including Stamford Hill following a surge in antisemitic incidents amid the violence in Gaza.
Earlier this week a skate park used by children in Notting Hill, west London, was graffitied with the message: ‘They’re evil. Jew ban due.’
Last week images of a Star of David with an X over it was spray painted onto a bus stop elsewhere in Stamford Hill.
Detective Chief Superintendent James Conway of the Metropolitan Police said: ‘Since the beginning of the conflict in Israel and Gaza, we have increased reassurance patrols across Stamford Hill and the wider area.
‘I would encourage anyone who has information about a suspect or anyone who was a victim of one of these hate offences to contact the team of detectives who are working with the local community to solve this crime.
‘We have been clear that hate has no place in London, and any allegation of antisemitism reported to police will be investigated robustly.’
Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at .
For more stories like this,
check our news page.

author: Waniya Malik
title: Apple ends its keyboard repair program: check if it affects you before it’s too late
text:
As of last week, this program is no longer widely available, meaning users with faulty keyboards may have to bear the cost of repairs.
What happened to butterfly keyboards? Butterfly keyboards debuted in 2015 with the 12-inch MacBook Retina. Designed to fit into the laptop’s slim profile, this mechanism promised more stable keys and a smoother typing experience. However, problems did not take long to appear. Many users complained about keys getting stuck, unresponsive, or generating repeated characters for no reason.
The problem worsened when Apple implemented this technology in the 2016 MacBook Pro and, later, in the MacBook Air. In 2018, complaints culminated in a class-action lawsuit in the United States, accusing Apple of selling laptops with defective keyboards . In addition, a group petition on the internet, demanding solutions, gathered almost 43,000 signatures.
In June 2018, Apple launched the Keyboard Service Program, which allowed users of select MacBook, MacBook Air, and MacBook Pro models to repair their keyboards for free. This service covered problems such as:
Letters or characters that were repeated unexpectedly. Keys that were not responding or displaying characters. Feeling of “sticky” keys or inconsistency in your response. The program covered repairs over a period of up to four years after the initial purchase of the device. However, since all affected models were discontinued more than four years ago, the eligibility period has expired.
Affected models and solutions If you have any of the following laptops, your device may have been part of the program:
MacBook Retina (12-inch) : 2015, 2016 and 2017 models. MacBook Air Retina (13-inch) : 2018 and 2019 models. MacBook Pro – 13- and 15-inch versions released between 2016 and 2019, with Thunderbolt 3 ports. Now that the program has ended, users of these models can no longer access guaranteed free repairs. However, Apple could make exceptions in specific cases if the device is still under warranty or covered by AppleCare+.
If you have a MacBook with a butterfly keyboard and are experiencing problems, here are your options:
Contact Apple or an authorized supplier : Although the program has ended, in some cases they may offer free repairs or discounts. Explore alternative solutions – Some users have found temporary remedies, such as cleaning the keys with compressed air, although this does not always solve the root problem. Consider a paid repair : If you need a definitive solution and have no other options, you could repair the keyboard at an official service center, assuming the cost.
Starting in 2019, Apple gradually abandoned the butterfly keyboard mechanism in favor of the more reliable and durable scissor keyboards. This change began with the 16-inch MacBook Pro released in November 2019 and extended to the entire laptop line with the most recent models.
The butterfly keyboard repair program represented an effort to mitigate one of the biggest design fiascos in recent Apple history. Although the service is no longer available, affected users still have options to keep their devices functional.
If you think your laptop might be affected, don’t wait. Check with Apple and act before it’s too late to find a workable solution.

author: News 3 Staff
title: chevron-right
text: {p}Sunny skies & breezy weather are in the forecast Thursday ahead of a strong weekend storm...{/p}{p}As of this morning, Lee Canyon is reporting 16” of new snowfall in the last 24 hours with a total season snow amount of 20.5”, so far. The National Weather Service is also reporting 7” of snow from the last storm at 6,582 ft in Lovell Summit, 10” around 7,046 ft in Kyle Canyon & 11” totals at 8,626 ft, 8,890 ft and 7,860 ft in elevation on Mt. Charleston.{/p}{p}TODAY: We're waking up to a few clouds this morning with wall to wall sunshine anticipated this afternoon. High temperatures will climb a bit higher compared to yesterday, reaching 58 degrees in Las Vegas, 53 degrees in Summerlin & around 59 degrees in Henderson.{/p}{p}Winds will be out of the north 10-20 mph with wind gusts around 30-35 mph. The strongest winds will happen in the northwest valley today.{/p}{p}Air quality is ranked 'good' and pollen levels remain low.{/p}{p}TONIGHT: Skies will go from clear this evening to partly cloudy overnight with valley low temperatures dropping to the mid and upper 30s. Winds will also gradually back down through the evening to northwest breezes 5-15 mph.{/p}{p}YOUR 7 DAY: A storm system will move in over the Intermountain West region with little impact expected locally. Breezes will pick up slightly on Friday afternoon in the valley around 5-15 mph with wind gusts up to around 20 mph.{/p}{p}Our next weathermaker is a much stronger storm diving south over the weekend. It looks like this storm will mostly be a wind event for our area. Weather models aren't completely in sync with the movement of the next storm but show the potential of more mountain snow on the way with an estimated 2\"-4\" additional inches of snow on the mountains. There's also a slight chance the valley could see some showers ahead of the strongest winds on Sunday but the odds stand at 20% as of now. Wind gusts on Sunday are expected to be between 30-40 mph with temperatures cooling into next week.{/p}{p}Valley highs will remain in the low 50s at the start of the work week with overnight lows near the freezing mark... this means with the winds blowing temperatures will feel like the upper teens to low 20s on Monday morning!{/p}{p}Beyond the 7-day, daytime highs appear to stay in the upper 40s to low 50s with another chance of stormy weather NEXT Friday into Saturday.{/p}{p}- Chloe Koast{ }{/p}{p}Celebrate the new year with DW Bistro's 14th annual Pajama Brunch!{/p}{p}It's a two-day celebration.{/p}{p}Owner, Bryce Krausman, joined us with more.{/p}{p}Sunny skies & breezy weather are in the forecast Thursday ahead of a strong weekend storm...{/p}{p}As of this morning, Lee Canyon is reporting 16” of new snowfall in the last 24 hours with a total season snow amount of 20.5”, so far. author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Saint Mary's Gaels Fall Short to Portland 58-66 Despite Rally
text:
Saint Mary’s Gaels Fall Short to Portland 58-66 Despite Rally
Saint Mary's women's basketball team exhibited remarkable resolve by rallying from a 14-point deficit against Portland but ultimately fell short, losing 66-58. The Gaels managed to tie the game late in the fourth quarter, thanks to a strong second half bolstered by Emily Foy's sharp shooting, but were unable to convert key opportunities down the stretch. Despite their defensive prowess and an inside scoring advantage, their inconsistent offense in the final minutes led to the loss, marking their fourth defeat in conference play.
- Saint Mary's scored 24 points in the paint compared to Portland's 9.
- Emily Foy led the Gaels with 13 points, while Maia Jones added 11 points.
Despite a valiant effort, the Gaels struggled offensively in critical moments, going just 1-of-11 during the final 5:30 of the game. Their strong defensive performance held Portland to only 39% shooting overall, yet their inability to capitalize on offensive opportunities undermined their efforts.
State of Play- Saint Mary's defense forced 16 turnovers from Portland.
- The Gaels currently hold a 7-4 record in the West Coast Conference, placing them fourth in the standings.
Looking ahead, Saint Mary's will continue their road trip in the Pacific Northwest, facing Oregon State on Saturday. This matchup presents an opportunity for the Gaels to rebound and improve their standing in conference play.
Bottom LineSaint Mary's displayed commendable tenacity but must enhance their offensive efficiency in clutch situations to secure future wins. The team's ability to capitalize on defensive stops could determine their trajectory going forward in the season.
Read more at SMC California Athletics
The summary of the linked article was generated with the assistance of artificial intelligence technology from OpenAI
